remarks: Define a function on two uniform structures which value is the set of uniformly continuous functions from the first uniform structure to the second.  A function ` f ` is uniformly continuous if, roughly speaking, it is possible to guarantee that ` ( f `` x ) ` and ` ( f `` y ) ` be as close to each other as we please by requiring only that ` x ` and ` y ` are sufficiently close to each other; unlike ordinary continuity, the maximum distance between ` ( f `` x ) ` and ` ( f `` y ) ` cannot depend on ` x ` and ` y ` themselves.  This formulation is the definition 1 of [BourbakiTop1] p.  II.6.  (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 16-Nov-2017.)
